Prative Chend Balasubramanian, CEO, CARE Group of Institutions, has been nominated as chair of the Tiruchi chapter of Young Indians (Yi), which is part of the Confederation of Indian Industry. John Ashok Varadarajan, Vice Chairman, Roever Group of Institutions, has been nominated co-chair, Yi, Tiruchi Chapter, according to a press release. Mr.Prative Chand had previously served as co-convener of the education panel of CII, Tiruchi. Mr.Varadarajan is also the co-chair of YUVA forum of Young Indians (YI), Tiruchi chapter.

“Waive all crop loans”

The farmers wing of the Tamil Maanila Congress has urged the Centre to constitute the Cauvery Management Board and Cauvery Water Regulatory Authority. In a statement issued here, A.Nagarajan, president of the farmers wing of the party, urged the government to prevent Karnataka from building dams across the Cauvery at Mekedatu and Rasimanal. The Mullaperiyar Dam should be provided security by the Central Industrial Security Force and steps should be taken to raise the storage level to 152 feet.

Mr.Nagarajan also urged the government to waive all crop loans and take steps to link all southern rivers.
title: TAMIL NADU
